intro: Rhynchelythrum eylesii, commonly known as the Eyles' rhynchelythrum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Rhynchelythrum eylesii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
